headline: Why Boeing (BA) Shares Are Sliding Today
summary: Shares of aerospace and defense company Boeing (NYSE:BA) fell 3.6% in the afternoon session after investors took some profits off the table as markets awaited signals on future monetary policy from the Federal Reserve's Jackson Hole symposium later in the week. The downturn in the market was largely attributed to a significant sell-off in megacap tech and chipmaker shares. Nvidia, Advanced Micro Devices (AMD), and Broadcom all saw notable drops, dragging down the VanEck Semiconductor ETF. Other

headline: Stock Market Today: Dow Ends Nearly Flat As Nasdaq Gets Hammered; Palantir, Nvidia Are Big Losers (Live Coverage)

headline: Will Trump's New Executive Order Fast-Track Lockheed's Space Ambitions?
summary: Trump's executive order streamlining space regulations could accelerate Lockheed's Orion, ULA launches and broader space ambitions.

headline: AI Infra Summit Brings Global AI Leaders to Santa Clara, Sept. 9-11
summary: The world's top minds in AI infrastructure will gather in Silicon Valley this September 9-11, 2025 for the AI Infra Summit at the Santa Clara Convention Center.
